alert.note: Alert for Putnam (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:44AM EST until February 22 at 4:45AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Ohio... Wabash River at Wabash affecting Cass IN, Miami and Wabash Counties. Auglaize River near Defiance affecting Defiance County. Blanchard River at Ottawa affecting Putnam County. Maumee River at Napoleon affecting Henry County. Maumee River near Defiance affecting Henry and Defiance Counties. .These river rises will shift ice within the river and could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Blanchard River at Ottawa. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Flooding begins along south Walnut and west Second Streets on the south side of Ottawa. At 26.6 feet, Flood water begins to hit the bottom of the bridge at the gage site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 26.0 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
